protein.specific_function: Conjugation of reduced glutathione to a wide number of exogenous and endogenous hydrophobic electrophiles. This isozyme has a high catalytic efficiency with 4-hydroxyalkenals such as 4-hydroxynonenal (4-HNE).

pathway.name: Metabolism of xenobiotics by cytochrome P450

go_class.description: transferase activity, transferring alkyl or aryl (other than methyl) groups

reference.reference_text: Hubatsch I, Ridderstrom M, Mannervik B: Human glutathione transferase A4-4: an alpha class enzyme with high catalytic efficiency in the conjugation of 4-hydroxynonenal and other genotoxic products of lipid peroxidation. Biochem J. 1998 Feb 15;330 ( Pt 1):175-9.
Board PG: Identification of cDNAs encoding two human alpha class glutathione transferases (GSTA3 and GSTA4) and the heterologous expression of GSTA4-4. Biochem J. 1998 Mar 1;330 ( Pt 2):827-31.
Liu S, Stoesz SP, Pickett CB: Identification of a novel human glutathione S-transferase using bioinformatics. Arch Biochem Biophys. 1998 Apr 15;352(2):306-13.

Desmots F, Rauch C, Henry C, Guillouzo A, Morel F: Genomic organization, 5'-flanking region and chromosomal localization of the human glutathione transferase A4 gene. Biochem J. 1998 Dec 1;336 ( Pt 2):437-42.
